page.title: 15HACKNEY CARRIAGE DRIVER.
page.content: We interviewed a London Cab Driver to find out about his job. He said his training took about 2years and in his training he had to learn many routes, street names,famous buildings,theatres ,hotels and other places.The number of routes that he covers is 90 to 130 a week.No more than 4 passengers are allowed inside a cab;this is one of the Hackney Carriage Laws. Some cabbies work nearly 50 hours each week.The cabbie that we spoke to thought cab driving had changed little over the years.He said that he did not enjoy his job as he got bored and lonely.His journey to work differs as he said sometimes he has to drive 7 miles to work and sometimes only 1 mile.Some cabbies have to pay for the diesel to fuel the cab;others don't depending on whether the cab is his or not.
